listitem.para: Status filtering will be handled at STAMP Coordinate-level.
Active/Inactive/Withdrawn should be retained in all necessary inclusion as part of a complete history (exports, logs, etc.). Canceled should not be retained.
A committed component that is currently in use and visible in the application.
Represents the default “live” state for any concept or semantic.
Displayed across all panels.
Backend Behavior - Fully committed; included in all indexes and exports. Should be retained in all necessary inclusion as part of a complete history (exports, logs, etc.)
A component that has been explicitly marked as no longer active but retained for history and traceability.
Used when a component is superseded, deprecated, or needs to be hidden from active use but still viewable.
Shown with inactive status; visible in history views and filters.
Backend Behavior: Should be retained in all necessary inclusion as part of a complete history (exports, logs, etc.)
A component that was released by mistake and must be treated as if it never existed (e.g., copyright violation, data breach, legal removal).
Rare case; typically used under legal or policy mandates.
Hidden from normal views; not shown in search or history unless explicitly surfaced.

Backend Behavior: Still exists in the database but treated as “voided”; Should be retained in all necessary inclusion as part of a complete history (exports, logs, etc.) unless user specifies does not want Withdrawn concepts.
A withdrawn status should never be recovered to be active or inactive.
Important Note: Withdrawn is distinct from inactive because it suppresses visibility and treats the component as fully retracted from the system.
A temporary/uncommitted component or version that was abandoned before being committed.
Happens when a user cancels a creation or exits the app without saving changes.
Never visible in the application; filtered from all user-facing views.
Backend Behavior: Exists only in transient state (with a “canceled” stamp). Subject to garbage collection and cleanup. Not included in exports since it is not a retained part of the history.
